titleStmt.title: Edward Crofery v. O. D. Butterfield. Servicing Writ Statement

bibl.title: Edward Crofery v. O. D. Butterfield. Servicing Writ Statement
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Territory of Washington, ss. County of King, I, James H. Woo ery, being first duly sworn on my oath depose and say: That I am over the age of 21 years, that I am a deputy Sheriff of the count of King that on this 11th., day of May1 889, acting as such deputy sheriff I had in my hands for service of a writ of Habeas Corpus, wherein one Edward Crofery was the petitioner, That the same was directed to O. D. Buterfeild to produce the body of the saidEdward Crofery before the Judge of the district court of the third judicial of Washington Territory, holding terms at Seattle in said King county. That I by virtue of the said writ proceeded to the police headquarters in said city on Yeslee Aveneu, west of Mill street. That when in front of said office I there met one E. Kinley a captain of police and made enquiry as to the whereabouts of the said O. D. Buterfield, That the United States Marshall was then and there present, and must have heard the converstaion. That I was informed that the said Buterfeild was in the office of J. F. Miller Justice of the Peace, that the office of the said Miller is directyl opposite the office of the said cheif of police headquarters that the said U. S. Marshall stated that he had a warrant for the arrest of the said Edward Crofery That I forthwith proceded to the office of the said Miller and served the said process upon the said Buterfeild. That the location of the said police headquarters is not more than about 100 feet from the said office of the said Miller. That the said Police headquarters is at lesat 500 feet from the Jail of said city of Seattle., Wherein the said Edward Crofery has been confined. J. H. Woolery Subscribed and sworn to before me this 11th., day of May, A. D., 1889 H. F. Jones Notary Public in and for Seattle Washington Territory.
